articles.title: Merkel tests negative for coronavirus
articles.description: Angela Merkel's initial test for coronavirus has returned a negative result, but the German leader's spokesman, Steffen Seibert, told news agency Deutsche Presse-Agentur that "further tests will be conducted in the coming days".

articles.title: Harvey Weinstein reported to have coronavirus
articles.description: Disgraced Hollywood mogul Harvey Weinstein has tested positive for the novel coronavirus, US media has reported.
articles.content:
Disgraced Hollywood mogul Harvey Weinstein has tested positive for the novel coronavirus, US media has reported. 
Weinstein, 68, is in prison in northern New York state after being sentenced to 23 years in jail for rape and sexual assault.

articles.title: Indian skies clear due to coronavirus lockdown
articles.description: Indians breathed easier as lockdowns ordered to combat the spread of the coronavirus in India's megacities kept cars off the road, letting people see blue skies instead of heavy grey smog.
articles.content:
Indians breathed easier as lockdowns ordered to combat the spread of the coronavirus in India's megacities kept cars off the road and closed factories, improving air quality and letting people see blue skies instead of heavy grey smog.

articles.title: Tributes to French doctor who died of coronavirus
articles.description: A French doctor caring for coronavirus patients has died from the virus, health authorities said, the first such death in the country that is grappling with the mushrooming outbreak.
articles.content:

articles.title: Mikel Arteta confirms recovery from coronavirus
articles.description: Arsenal boss Mikel Arteta says he has now fully recovered from coronavirus and outlines the timeline from his diagnosis to recovery.
articles.content:
Arsenal boss Mikel Arteta says he has now fully recovered from coronavirus.
The 37-year-old tested positive for the virus 10 days ago, just before the Premier League postponed all its fixtures.
